CHAT.comment: SIS's backround babbling not always transcribed
Book Reading; The Very Hungry Caterpillar

MOT gives semantic rather than print clue for Christa. Chi is a pretty fluent reader , obviously reading word by word since pauses not always at clause boundaries. Mot's intonation sounds like she's pretty bored with the task , but that's not necessarily true. Chi misses words within a sentence (after that he left much (better)) that also indicate preoccupation with single words. Context notes say that Chi reads the words and rarely looks at the pictures

u.a: MOT asks Chi about caterpillar at school
Chi sits on floor , Indian style , next to Mother , who is seated in a rocking chair . Mot looks on as Chi reads
SIS talking or humming continuously - not always transcribed
Chi reads words as mother points to them
